definition: Bo Xilai (1949-), PRC politician, appointed to the Politburo in 2007, sentenced in 2013 to life imprisonment for corruption and misconduct
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
see 薄荷[bo4 he5]
surname Bo
thin/cold in manner/indifferent/weak/light/infertile
(used in names)/(bound form) (literary) bright/prosperous/splendid/genial
variant of 熙[xi1]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Nikai was already scheduled to meet Chinese Commerce Minister Bo Xilai during his visit, which ends Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 二阶俊博计划与中国商务部部长薄熙来会面。

sentences.english: Mr.Bo appeared, singing twice and introducing Red Army veterans.
sentences.chinese: 薄熙来出场唱歌两次并介绍了红军老战士。

sentences.english: Gingkos are the backbone of a greenery campaign initiated by Mr. Bo, the party secretary.
sentences.chinese: 移植银杏树是市委书记薄熙来推行绿色运动的重点。

sentences.english: During his visit, Minister Bo Xilai will hold talks with him.
sentences.chinese: 访问期间，薄熙来部长将与他进行会谈。

definition: Zhou Yongkang (1942-), PRC petroleum engineer and politician

Chen Xitong (1930-), mayor of Beijing at the time of 4th Jun 1989 Tiananmen incident

buying and selling of official positions
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
shuanggui, an extralegal system within the CCP for detaining and interrogating cadres who fall from grace
Wang Hongwen (1935-1992), one of the Gang of Four
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Zhao Leji (1957-), member of the Politburo Standing Committee and Secretary of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
Kang Sheng (1896-1975), Chinese communist leader, a politburo member during the Cultural Revolution and posthumously blamed for some of its excesses

definition: to oppose corruption/anti-graft (measures, policy etc)
Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
